entry.title: Re: Calling an external web service via https using the system certificate store
entry.content: SNI is Server Name Indication. As to your POST request, is it expected that is has no body? (At least, that's quite unusual IMHO.) Generally, I would compare the logged requests and responses of your SA web client with that of other working clients and try to find relevant differences. Aside: I'm just another SAP customer so you might ask the official SAP support for more.

entry.title: How to migrate data from S4HANA Cloud Private to S4HANA Cloud Public?
entry.content:
According to the guide SAP S/4HANA Migration Cockpit SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition,
The SAP S/4HANA Migration Cockpit, is Not designed for:

"Migrating data directly from SAP S/4HANA system to other SAP S/4HANA systems independent of deployment option is currently not supported"

Therefore, what alternatives do we have if a client is in S4HANA Cloud Private and wants to migrate their data to a new S4HANA Cloud Public system? This isn't a greenfield deployment, but rather a conversion. Is there a plan to provide an SAP application that can facilitate this type of migration?

I would appreciate any suggestions or links that might help.

entry.title: PLM Tech Uncovered: SAP Integrated Product Development Update 10/2025
entry.content:
PLM Tech Uncovered: SAP Integrated Product Development Update 10/2025

Hello and welcome to the October 2025 blog in this series! I’m excited to walk you through the latest SAP Integrated Product Development features - let’s dive in:

Change Management

Linking Change Validities Within Change Processes
In the Manage Change Processes app, you can link change validities to change processes.
The product structure uses these validities to determine the “valid from” date, indicating when a change should take effect. They can also be referenced to track and document the implementation of changes to specific business objects.

Enterprise Product Structure

Date validity available for product structure editing
You can edit a product structure by specifying when the edits become effective. In the Configure Product Structure app, administrators can specify whether a structure type is edited by date validity or as a versioned structure, and whether a change ID is required for an editing profile. If a change ID is mandatory, users must select one when editing a product structure with that profile. Users can view a component’s header change ID and its validity in the Header Data section of the Structure Editor screen.

Product Data Integration

Synchronize attributes from authoring tool to EPS product
Design engineers can synchronize attributes and properties from a CAD authoring tool to an EPS product linked to a PDI Design Item, making the authoring-system information available for downstream business processes.

Specification Management

Add specifications to collaborations from the Find Specifications app
You can add specifications to existing collaborations directly from the search results in the Find Specifications app.

To stay informed until the next update you can:
✏️Subscribe to the What’s New Viewer on SAP Integrated Product Development Help Portal
🔗Join our LinkedIn group SAP Solutions for PLM 
🌐Visit us at www.sap.com/IPD

📢Want to give feedback on SAP Integrated Product Development?
Watch this short 📺  video to see how, then send your feedback directly from the app - we’d love to hear from you.

entry.title: Enhancing SAP S/4HANA Business Partner with a Custom Tab
entry.content:
📘 Comprehensive Guide: Enhancing SAP S/4HANA Business Partner with a Custom Tab

This guide provides a complete, end-to-end process for consultants, key users, and end-users on how to enhance the SAP S/4HANA Business Partner (BP) master data screen. We will walk through the technical steps to add a new, custom tabulation (tab) that displays and saves custom fields, based on the specific "FID" bank details example from your document.

Business Goal: The standard SAP Business Partner screen needs to capture additional, company-specific bank information that is not available in the standard fields. In this case, we need to add a new tab called "Bank details (FID)" to store indicators for "Customer Account Type" and "Vendor Account Type".

This guide is broken into three parts:

  1. The End-User Experience: What the final result looks like.
  2. The "How-To" Build Guide: A detailed, step-by-step tutorial for consultants and key users on how to implement this enhancement.
  3. The Test Plan: A practical, real-world business case to validate the solution.
  1. The End-User Experience (The "What") 🧑‍💼

As an end-user (such as a Master Data Steward or Finance Clerk), your interaction with the system is simple. When you open the Maintain Business Partner app (or BP transaction), you will see the enhancement directly on the screen.

Business Process: Maintaining FID Bank Data

  1. Access Business Partner: You open the Manage Business Partner Master Data Fiori app or run transaction BP.
  2. Find BP: You search for and open a Business Partner, for example, 1009 (F-LYON).
  3. View Custom Tab: In the "General Data" for the BP, you will see a new tab labeled "Bank details (FID)" alongside the standard tabs like "Address" and "Payment Transactions".
  4. View Data: Clicking this tab displays the custom bank information, including the standard bank details and the new custom fields, such as "Indicator: Customer Account Type" and "Indicator: Vendor Account Type".
  5. Edit Data: In change mode, you can edit these fields (e.g., check a box) just like any standard field. When you save the Business Partner, this custom information is saved with it.
  1. The "How-To" Build Guide (The "How") 🛠️

This section is for Consultants and Key Users. We will build the enhancement shown in your documents from start to finish.

2.1 Concepts: How BP Enhancement Works (The BDT)

To add new tabs or fields to the BP transaction, SAP provides a standard framework called the Business Data Toolset (BDT). Think of the BP screen not as one single program, but as a collection of building blocks.

  • Data Set: A logical grouping of data (e.g., "Bank Details").
  • View: A single subscreen (dynpro) that displays data. This is what you create in the Screen Painter.
  • Section: A container that holds one or more "Views."
  • Screen: A container that holds one or more "Sections." This is what appears as a Tab.
  • Screen Sequence: Defines the order of all "Screens" (Tabs) for a specific BP role or view (like "General Data").

Our goal is to create our own custom View, Section, and Screen, and then add our new Screen (Tab) to the standard Screen Sequence.

2.2 The Build Process: Step-by-Step

Here is the complete process to replicate the "Bank details (FID)" enhancement.

Step 1: Create the Data Model (The Foundation)

First, we need a place to store our new custom data.

  1. Go to Transaction SE11 (ABAP Dictionary).
  2. Create a Custom Table: Create a transparent table named ZBUT0BK.
    • Description: "BP: Bank Details (FID)"
    • Fields:
      • MANDT (Key)
      • PARTNER (Key) (Type BU_PARTNER)
      • BUKRS (Key) (Type BUKRS)
      • BKVID (Key) (Type BU_BKVID)
      • ZZXDEBI: "Indicator: Customer Account Type" (Type XFELD)
      • ZZXKRED: "Indicator: Vendor Account Type" (Type XFELD)
    • Note: This table will hold our custom indicators, linked to the BP's main bank data key. Your document also shows these fields appended to BUT0BK, which is necessary so the standard bank data structure (used by the screen) is aware of them.

Step 2: Create the Screen (The User Interface)

Next, we create the actual screen (dynpro) that the user will see.

  1. Go to SE80 or SE38 to create a new Function Group (e.g., ZUD0). SAPLZUD0 is the program name for this function group.
  2. Go to SE51 (Screen Painter).
  3. Create Screen:
    • Program: SAPLZUD0
    • Screen number: 1500
  4. Design the Layout:
    • Use the graphical editor to design the layout. You will likely add a Table Control (like GT_BUT0BK in the doc) to display multiple bank entries.
    • Add fields from your program's global data (see Step 3) for your custom fields (e.g., GT_BUT0BK-ZZXDEBI, GT_BUT0BK-ZZXKRED).
  5. Write the Flow Logic:
    • The flow logic connects the screen to your ABAP code. Your document shows the following logic:

ABAP

PROCESS BEFORE OUTPUT.

* MODULE PBO_1500.

  LOOP AT GT_BUT0BK WITH CONTROL TCTRL_BUT0BK CURSOR GV_BK_LINACT.

    MODULE GT_BUT0BK_INIT.

  ENDLOOP.

  MODULE TCTRL_PBO.

  MODULE SEPA_MANADATE_PBO.

 

PROCESS AFTER INPUT.

* MODULE PAI.

  LOOP AT GT_BUT0BK.

    MODULE GT_BUT0BK_MODIFY.

  ENDLOOP.

  MODULE BANK_DETAILS_CURSOR_GET.

  MODULE GT_BUT0BK_LINACT_DETERMINE.

  MODULE GT_BUT0BK_MARK_SINGLE.

Step 3: Create the Logic (The "Engine")

This ABAP code defines what happens during BDT events (e.g., loading or saving data).

  1. Go to SE37 (Function Builder).
  2. Create BDT Event Function Modules:
    • ZUP_BUPA_PBC_MISC (Before screen callup): Loads data from the database.
    • ZUP_BUPA_PBO_MISC (Before Output): Prepares data for display.
    • ZUP_BUPA_PAI_MISC (After Entry): Saves data from the screen.
  3. Add Code to ZUP_BUPA_PBC_MISC:
    • This FM calls a FORM routine (e.g., BUP500_PBC) inside your function group LZUD0F00 (an include in SAPLZUD0).
    • Key Logic (from your doc): This code reads both the standard bank data and your custom Z-table data, combining them into a single internal table (GT_BUT0BK) for the screen.

ABAP

*... (Inside FORM BUP500_PBC) ...

* Get the current BP number

CHECK CVI_BDT_ADAPTER=>IS_DIRECT_INPUT_ACTIVE( ) = ABAP_FALSE.

CHECK CVI_BDT_ADAPTER=>GET_CURRENT_BP( ) IS NOT INITIAL.

CLEAR GV_PARTNER.

CALL METHOD CVI_BDT_ADAPTER=>GET_CURRENT_BP

  RECEIVING

    R_PARTNER = GV_PARTNER. [cite: 105, 106]

 

* Fill table control table GT_BUT0BK from standard table

SELECT * FROM BUT0BK INTO CORRESPONDING FIELDS OF TABLE XBUT0BK

  WHERE PARTNER = GV_PARTNER. [cite: 106]

 

*... (Logic to move XBUT0BK to GT_BUT0BK) ...

REFRESH GT_BUT0BK.

LOOP AT XBUT0BK.

  CLEAR GT_BUT0BK.

  MOVE-CORRESPONDING XBUT0BK TO GT_BUT0BK. [cite: 108]

 

  * Now read custom Z-table data for this entry

  READ TABLE GT_ZBUT0BK INTO GS_ZBUT0BK

       WITH KEY PARTNER = XBUT0BK-PARTNER.

       *... (add BKVID and BUKRS to key if needed) ... [cite: 109]

  IF SY-SUBRC = 0.

    GT_BUT0BK-ZZBUKRS = GS_ZBUT0BK-BUKRS.

    GT_BUT0BK-ZZXDEBI = GS_ZBUT0BK-ZZXDEBI. [cite: 110]

    GT_BUT0BK-ZZXKRED = GS_ZBUT0BK-ZZXKRED. [cite: 111]

  ENDIF.

  APPEND GT_BUT0BK.

ENDLOOP.

    • Note: You must also create the ZUP_BUPA_PAI_MISC logic to update/modify/insert entries in your ZBUT0BK table when the user saves.

Step 4: Configure BDT (The "Wiring")

Now we use the BDT BUS* transactions (via SM30 or directly) to connect all our objects.

  1. BUS23 (Data Sets):
    • Create Data Set ZUF020 ("Bank Details (FID)").
  2. BUS2 (Field Groups):
    • Create Field Group 6009 ("Bank Details (FID)").
    • Assign your fields (e.g., BUT0BK-BKVID, GT_BUT0BK-ZZXDEBI, GT_BUT0BK-ZZXKRED) to this group. This links the fields to the field group for screen control.
  3. BUS3 (Views):
    • This is the most critical step. Create View ZUF500 ("Bank Details").
    • Application: BUP
    • Data Set: ZUF020
    • Subscreen: Program SAPLZUD0, Screen 1500
    • Function Modules:
      • Before screen callup: ZUP_BUPA_PBC_MISC
      • Before Output: ZUP_BUPA_PBO_MISC
      • After Entry: ZUP_BUPA_PAI_MISC
  4. BUS4 (Sections):
    • Create Section ZUF500 ("BP Bank Details").
    • Assign your View ZUF500 to this section.
  5. BUS5 (Screens):
    • Create Screen ZUF500 ("Bank details (FID)").
    • Set Screen Type to "Data Screen" and Screen origin to "BDT".
    • Assign your Section ZUF500 to this screen.
  6. BUS6 (Screen Sequences):
    • Find the standard Screen Sequence BUP001 ("General Data").
    • Go to "Screen Sequence -> Screens".
    • Add a new entry: your Screen ZUF500 ("Bank details (FID)"). This adds your custom screen as a new tab to the "General Data" view.
  7. BUSD (BP Views):
    • Select BP View 000000 ("Business Partner (General)").
    • Go to "BP View -> Data Sets".
    • Add a new entry: your Data Set ZUF020 ("Bank Details (FID)"). This links your data to the main BP application.

Step 5: Configure Field Control (The "Permissions")

Finally, we must make our new fields visible.

  1. Go to SPRO: Cross-Application Components -> SAP Business Partner -> Business Partner -> Basic Settings -> Field Groupings -> Configure Field Attributes per Client.
  2. Configure Attributes:
    • Select the activity "Configure Field Attributes for Each Client".
    • Find your new Field Group 6009 ("Bank Details (FID)").
    • Set its status to "Opt. entry" (Optional entry).
    • Also, ensure the standard "Bank Details" field group (e.g., 9) is set to "Opt. entry" or "Display" so the standard bank data is visible.
  3. Save your changes.
  1. The Test Plan (The "Verification") 🧪

Now, let's test the complete solution with a practical business case.

3.1 Business Case

A Finance Clerk needs to maintain special "FID" bank indicators for Business Partner 1009 (F-LYON). This BP already has standard bank details. The clerk must verify the new tab, confirm it loads the correct data, and ensure that changes are saved correctly to the custom table ZBUT0BK.

3.2 Master Data & Test Data Preparation

  1. Business Partner: Ensure BP 1009 exists in the system.
  2. Standard Bank Data: Ensure BP 1009 has at least one bank detail entry in table BUT0BK. (Example: IBAN FR2714508... ).
  3. Custom Bank Data:
    • Go to transaction SM30.
    • Enter table/view ZBUT0BK and click "Maintain".
    • Create a new entry matching the BP's bank data:
      • Partner: 1009
      • CoCd: 0001 (or the relevant Company Code from BUT0BK)
      • Customer: X (Set this indicator)
      • Vendor: (Leave blank)
    • Save the entry.

3.3 Test Procedure

Test Step #

Test Step Name

Instruction

Expected Result

Pass/Fail

1

Log On & Access BP

Log on as a Master Data Steward. Open the Maintain Business Partner app (or BP transaction).

The Maintain Business Partner screen appears.

 

2

Find Business Partner

Find and open BP 1009.

BP 1009 (F-LYON) is displayed.

 

3

Verify Custom Tab

Ensure you are in the "General Data" role (e.g., 000000). Look at the row of tabs.

A new tab "Bank details (FID)" is visible.

 

4

Verify Data Load (PBC)

Click the "Bank details (FID)" tab.

The screen displays the bank data for BP 1009. The custom checkbox "Indicator: Customer Account Type" is checked (from our SM30 data). The "Vendor" checkbox is unchecked.

 

5

Verify Field Control (SPRO)

Click the "Change" button to enter edit mode.

The custom fields ("Customer," "Vendor") are ready for input (not grayed out), confirming the "Opt. entry" setting.

 

6

Verify Data Change (PAI)

Check the "Indicator: Vendor Account Type" box. Click Save.

The Business Partner is saved without errors.

 

7

Verify Data Persistence (UI)

Re-open BP 1009 in display mode and navigate back to the "Bank details (FID)" tab.

Both checkboxes ("Customer" and "Vendor") are now checked. The change was saved.

 

8

Verify Data Persistence (DB)

Go to SE16N. Open table ZBUT0BK. Enter PARTNER = 1009. Execute.

The record for BP 1009 is displayed. The fields ZZXDEBI and ZZXKRED are both set to 'X'.

 

Export to Sheets

  1. Conclusion

You have successfully enhanced the SAP S/4HANA Business Partner master data. By following the standard Business Data Toolset (BDT) framework, you have created an upgrade-safe custom tab. This process involved:

  1. Creating the Data Model (ZBUT0BK).
  2. Building the UI (SE51) and Logic (SE37).
  3. Wiring everything together using the BDT (BUS* transactions).
  4. Setting field permissions (SPRO).

This enhancement provides a flexible way to meet specific business requirements directly within the standard master data transaction, ensuring a seamless experience for your end-users.

 

 

SAP S/4HANA BP screen enhancement with custom tabulation

 

I will add some custom fields to an additional tabulation:

[Custom fields attached on table BUT0BK and ZBUT0BK tables needs to place on Business Partner custom tab for updates]

 

 

Steps –

 

BUS23

 

BUS4

 

BUS5

 

 

 

 

BUS6

 

 

 

 

 

Screen is attached to BUP001     General Data

BUS3

 

 

Program Name SAPLZUD0

Screen number 1500

 

 

Before screen callup      ZUP_BUPA_PBC_MISC

Before Output   ZUP_BUPA_PBO_MISC

After Entry         ZUP_BUPA_PAI_MISC

BUS2

 

 

 

 

 

BUSD – Data Set attached to standard Business Role

 

 

 

 

 

Screen Painter Concepts

The Screen Painter is a ABAP Workbench tool that allows you to create screens for your transactions. You use it both to create the screen itself, with fields and other graphical elements, and to write the flow logic behind the screen.

Note

In older documentation, screens are sometimes referred to as dynpros. This is short for "Dynamic Program", and means the combination of the screen and its accompanying flow logic.

Screen Painter Architecture

You use the Screen Painter to create and maintain all elements of a screen. These are:

Screen Attributes

Describe a screen object in the R/3 System. Screen attributes include the program the screen belongs to and the screen type.

Screen layout

Screen elements are the parts of a screen with which the user interacts. Screen elements include checkboxes and radio buttons.

Elements

Correspond to screen elements. Fields are defined in the ABAP Dictionary or in your program.

Flow logic

Controls the flow of your program.

Two Screen Painter Modes

The Screen Painter has a layout editor that you use to design your screen layout. It works in two modes:

  • Graphical mode and
  • Alphanumeric mode .

Both modes offer the same functions but use different interfaces. In graphical mode, you use a drag and drop interface similar to a drawing tool. In alphanumeric mode, you use your keyboard and menus.

Graphical mode is available only on MS Windows 95, MS Windows NT, and Unix/Motif platforms.

To activate the graphical mode, choose Utilities  Settings in the Screen Painter, then select the Graphical layout editor option.

Creating a Screen: Basics

  1. Create a screen in an existing program and define its attributes.
  2. Design the screen layout and define the attributes of the elements.
  3. Write the flow logic.

Basic Principles

  • Uses predefined elements with links to the ABAP Dictionary or program.
  • Supports forwards navigation.
  • Supports complex elements: Table Control and Tabstrip Control, and Custom Container.
  • Cut/ Copy/ Paste ( Graph. fullscreen)
  • Undo/ Redo ( Graph. fullscreen)

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Before screen callup      ZUP_BUPA_PBC_MISC

 

 

 

  CHECK CVI_BDT_ADAPTER=>IS_DIRECT_INPUT_ACTIVE( ) = ABAP_FALSE.
  CHECK CVI_BDT_ADAPTER=>GET_CURRENT_BP( ) IS NOT INITIAL.

  CLEAR GV_PARTNER.
  CALL METHOD CVI_BDT_ADAPTER=>GET_CURRENT_BP
    RECEIVING
      R_PARTNER = GV_PARTNER.

*------ fill table control table GT_BUT0BK from table -------------------
  SELECT * FROM BUT0BK INTO CORRESPONDING FIELDS OF TABLE XBUT0BK
   WHERE PARTNER = GV_PARTNER.

  REFRESH GT_ZBUT0BK.
  SELECT * FROM ZBUT0BK INTO CORRESPONDING FIELDS OF TABLE GT_ZBUT0BK
   WHERE PARTNER = GV_PARTNER.

*------ fill table control table GT_BUT0BK from table -------------------
*------ XBUT0BK --------------------------------------------------------
  REFRESH GT_BUT0BK.
  LOOP AT XBUT0BK.
    CLEAR GT_BUT0BK.
    MOVE-CORRESPONDING XBUT0BK TO GT_BUT0BK.
    READ TABLE GT_ZBUT0BK INTO GS_ZBUT0BK WITH KEY PARTNER = XBUT0BK-PARTNER.
    IF SY-SUBRC = 0.
      GT_BUT0BK-ZZBUKRS = GS_ZBUT0BK-BUKRS.
      GT_BUT0BK-ZZXDEBI =G S_ZBUT0BK-ZZXDEBI.
      GT_BUT0BK-ZZXKRED = GS_ZBUT0BK-ZZXKRED.
    ENDIF.

Before Output   ZUP_BUPA_PBO_MISC

After Entry         ZUP_BUPA_PAI_MISC

 

BP Screen–

 

 

 

 

Configure Field Attributes per Client

In this activity you define which fields at field group level in master record maintenance (for example BUPA for SAP Business Partner and BUPR for Business Partner Relationships)

  • Require an entry (required entry)
  • Are ready for input (optional entry)
  • Are displayed (display)
  • Are hidden (hide),

depending on the application object.

This definition is linked with the field status of the other criteria. The status of the field in the input screen for master data is derived from this link.

Activities

Check the attributes delivered, and change if necessary.

entry.title: Cancellation of a reversal in transaction RERAPPRV, for a SAF-T PT certified document
entry.content:
Hello,

A reversal of an RE document (using transaction RERAPPRV) was carried out for a previous month, which had already been certified and reported to the Portuguese tax authority through the SAF-T PT file.

With this reversal, the reversed RE document is no longer consistent with the communication made through the SAF-T PT file, as it is canceled in our system but invoiced in the Portuguese tax authority’s system.

Is there any way to undo/cancel the reversal so that the RE document is no longer reversed?

 

Thanks in advance!

entry.title: Restrict only “Unblock for Payment” in Manage Supplier Line Items app.
entry.content:
Hi Team,

In the app Manage Supplier Line Items (Public Cloud) our business requirement is:

  • Allow the “Block for Payment” tab for users.

  • Restrict the “Unblock for Payment” tab so users cannot unblock line items.

What we have done:

  • We set the “Authorization Group for Journal Entry Document Type” to Not Maintained.

  • Result: Both “Block for Payment” and “Unblock for Payment” tabs got restricted (i.e., inaccessible).

Our question:

  • Is it possible to allow only “Block for Payment” and restrict only “Unblock for Payment”?

  • Are there additional authorisations or configuration settings (catalogues/roles) in Public Cloud which support this level of segregation?

  • Any SAP Notes or documentation for this scenario in Public Cloud?

Thanks in advance for your guidance!

Thanks & Regards

Sandeep

entry.title: SAP System Refresh through LAMA 3.0 SP 34 is failing at Post copy automation import
entry.content:
Hi All,

We are currently performing System refresh through the LAMA using the restore based refresh procedure in lama and we are stuck at the Post copy automation import step.

LAMA executed PCA export and while import step post restore is failing with the error

id 10: Invalid XML format [Error: 00/001] 

id 11:Execution of RFC 'STC_TM_SESSION_IMPORT' failed!

id 12:Error occured: com.sap.nw.lm.aci.engine.base.api.util.exception.EngineBaseException: Execution of RFC 'STC_TM_SESSION_IMPORT' failed!

and the logs:

Exception thrown by Operation handler when executing process step with ID 'process-aed400dc-b5a4-11f0-ca06-000006784226-step-32'
[EXCEPTION]
com.sap.nw.lm.aci.engine.base.exception.EngineException: com.sap.nw.lm.aci.engine.base.api.util.exception.EngineBaseException: Execution of RFC 'STC_TM_SESSION_IMPORT' failed!
at com.sap.tc.vcm.engine.operation.handler.provisioning.PSCAHandler.execute(PSCAHandler.java:162)
at com.sap.tc.vcm.process.framework.process.ProcessStepExecutionListener.executeOperationHandlerPhase(ProcessStepExecutionListener.java:305)

entry.title: Re: Has anyone extended CALM?
entry.content:
Hi,

Let me try to answer your questions

1. How can custom logic be integrated into CALM?

Could you please give me more details on what you would like to achieve?

2. How can custom apps be integrated into CALM?

SAP Cloud ALM provides public API for integration with custom apps or 3rd party tools.

https://api.sap.com/package/SAPCloudALM/overview

3. Can CALM be integrated into Workzone?

I'm not a Workzone expert but you can create tiles in Workzone and link them to SAP Cloud ALM applications.

4. Is it possible to access Hana behind CALM? I know that there are many APIs.

No. SAP Cloud ALM APIs are available to push or pull data.

5. Can standard apps from CALM be extended?

Yes, using APIs.

6. Is there a way to display logs from CALM in the Cloud Logging Service? In particular, SLG1 from SAP.

There is a way to integrate SAP Cloud ALM with Cloud Logging Service.  https://support.sap.com/en/alm/sap-cloud-alm/operations/expert-portal/setup-managed-services/calm-setup-cl.html

Best regards,

Xavier

entry.title: Accelerate Your Transformation journey with the SAP Customer Evolution Kit
entry.content:
What Is the SAP Customer Evolution Kit?

The SAP Customer Evolution Kit is a personalized, high-touch engagement lasting just 3–5 days. 1:1 virtual sessions with dedicated SAP experts, your team receives tailored insights, real-time simulations, and practical guidance to plan your cloud or hybrid transition. The objective is to help business owners, IT leaders, and key users make informed decisions about modernization, digital transformation, and the evolution of your SAP landscape.

Who can benefit?

The program is designed for SAP ERP/ECC, S/4HANA On-Premise, and a broad array of LoB solutions (finance, supply chain, procurement, HR, CX, and more). If your organization is considering the future – migration, process innovation, or simply staying ahead – this engagement gives you the clarity and support needed.

Why Consider Moving to SAP Business Suite?

Migrating to SAP Business Suite (S/4HANA – cloud or hybrid editions) unlocks the power of in-memory computing, AI-driven automation, and real-time analytics. It ensures compliance with the latest security and regulatory standards, seamless upgrades, and access to the newest ERP features. Data moves more freely, processes are optimized, and your business is prepared for tomorrow’s opportunities, among many others today's and future Business 

Maintenance Strategy: Key Dates to Know

SAP has announced important changes:

  • Mainstream maintenance  for SAP ECC EhP 0-5 ends in Dec 31, 2025 and for EhP 6-8 & Business Suite 7 ends in 2027.
  • Extended maintenance is available (with additional fees) through 2030.

Moving to S/4HANA or SAP Business Suite is not just a technical migration—it’s a strategic imperative to stay secure, and remain competitive.

Check the information about SAP software releases: release types, maintenance durations, planned availability, and upgrade paths at Product Availability Matrix (PAM).

Learn more about the SAP Release and Maintenance Strategy

Get Started:

If your organization has an active SAP support agreement, you can sign up for the SAP Customer Evolution Kit free of charge here: https://events.sap.com/sap-customer-evolution-kit/en_us/home.html

Register today and don’t miss this opportunity to accelerate your journey with confident planning and expert support.

entry.title: How to monitor consumption for SAP Business Data Cloud (BDC) and its components?
entry.content:
Symptom: You don't know how to check SAP Business Data Cloud (BDC) usage.

Requirements: You need to have an S-user and the role of Super Administrator assigned in SAP for Me. 

  • If you don't have an S-User, please check this page.
  • If you are unsure which role you have, please check this note. 

Resolution:

1) Open SAP for Me and log in.

2) Navigate to the "Dashboards" section and click "Finance & Legal".

3) Select "Consumption".

4) Filter for "Business Data Cloud".

5) Click on the measured number to open a card; it explains the consumption by each metric. 

Image 01

 

Image 2

Important reminder: SAP Databricks and SAP Datasphere usage is based on actual consumption instead of what is in the quota assignment. For SAP Analytics Cloud, on the other hand, it is considered the number of users assigned for each SAC license according to the quota assignment. For more information on the components usage (SAP Analytics Cloud, SAP Datasphere), please refer to this documentation. If you want to know more about how the metric itself works, check this pdf.

Hi @XavierPicquart ,

1. For example, the customer does not want to receive a notification for every error, but only after the third error. Currently, CALM can only generate a notification for the first error or for every error. I could take this further with my own logic, e.g. that the notifications must follow a certain pattern. 6. Are there any further details available? Including the available features?

Best regards

Andre

entry.title: Crystal Reports running extremely slow in SAGE after PC Upgrade
entry.content:
Hello, we have recently encountered and issue with Crystal Reports in Sage Timberline/300 CRE running extremely slowly on some new PCs that were deployed.

Not all accounting PCs were replaced, the user still using an 'older' PC is able to run a large report in 2-3 minutes. The same large report takes 10min+ on one of the 'new' machines.

Two newer machines were deployed and exhibit the exact same symptoms.

We whitelisted Sage and Crystal reports in Antivirus even though all 3 systems use the same antivirus.

We reinstalled the entirety of Sage and Crystal reports

We exported registry keys from the working machine to make sure 32 and 64bit ODBC drivers matched 100%

We tried to run the report pointing to different printer drivers

SFC and DISM scans have been run on the machines and pass clean

Nothing else was replaced networking wise, switches, etc. These users have the same connection to the LAN they had before when the reports ran fine.

NEW
HP Elite Mini 800 G9 Desktop PC
12th Gen Intel(R) Core(TM) i7-12700T (20 virtual) (X64)
16GB RAM
Win 11 Pro


OLD
HP ProDesk 600 G3 DM
Intel(R) Core(TM) i7-6700T CPU @ 2.80GHz (8 virtual) (X64)
16GB RAM
Win 10 Pro

 

Any help or advise anyone can provide is greatly appreciated, thanks in advance!!

entry.title: cycle count completion indicator
entry.content: We moved to S4 Hana with EWM just this May. Nailing down cycle counts has been challenging. We operate in two warehouses under the same roof, raw materials and finished goods. All parts selected for count are counted in all warehouses and all locations. The issue we are having is accurate reflection of whether a part has been counted or not. Our ABC parts are broken out as such, A parts counted every qtr or 4 times a year, B parts every six months or 2X per year and C parts 1 per year. We may count a part today and trace completion results back through - Physical Inventory Progress>Cycle Counting. In the upper table we select "All Products".  The lower table displays all products. Within that table there are multiple columns. We have been instructed to focus on the column "Compl.Sts" to determine if count requirements have been met for the period for that line-item part. Those items that do not have a "X" are those that have not been counted per the requirements within the period. Our problem is that we have seen time and again on many parts that on the day we count, the "X" is present. Then when viewing the same tile following the same path, the "X" indicating completed is no longer populated. As a result, we end up counting the same part numbers multiple times across days and weeks. Some part numbers we count are flagged with the "X" that remains without issue. So, we are trying to understand why the counted flag for the parts affected doesn't remain causing additional, unnecessary counts and also creates issue when trying to explain to outside auditors. Are we looking in the wrong area? Do we have flags not set or set incorrectly? What steps do we need to take so we get accurate data?

entry.title: Best practices and process design for using Procurement Type “X” (Make-or-Buy) in SAP ERP
entry.content:
Hello SAP experts,

I’m currently working on a project dealing with the configuration and process implications of using Procurement Type “X” (both in-house and external procurement) for semi-finished and assembly materials in an SAP environment.

Our goal is to understand whether procurement type “X” can be implemented effectively and what process controls and reporting designs are needed to maintain costing accuracy, transparency, and audit compliance,  or whether using two separate material numbers (one for in-house, one for external) is the more sustainable approach.

In our analysis, we have identified advantages (e.g. reduced master data maintenance, simplified BOMs, flexible quota arrangements) and disadvantages (e.g. mixed costing, valuation inconsistencies, transparency and audit concerns, high coordination effort between SCM and Controlling).

I’d like to ask the community for insights or best practices on the following:

  1. Process design:
    What does a clean, transparent process for reconciling in-house and external procurement under procurement type “X” look like, especially regarding communication and data maintenance between SCM and Controlling?

  2. Costing and valuation:
    How do you handle mixed costing or valuation when the in-house/external ratio changes dynamically during the year? Are there SAP-standard functionalities or best-practice workarounds to ensure consistent costing and stock valuation?

  3. Reporting and traceability:
    What reporting setups or SAP tools (standard or custom) are commonly used to analyze internal vs. external shares under procurement type “X”?
    How do you maintain audit-proof transparency in such cases?

  4. Governance and system configuration:
    Are there recommended decision criteria or governance frameworks (e.g. when to use procurement type X vs. separate materials) used in practice to balance flexibility vs. compliance?

I’m particularly interested in learning from companies that successfully implemented procurement type X for Make-or-Buy scenarios without losing control over costing, valuation, and transparency.

Thank you in advance for your insights and experiences!
Best regards!

entry.title: Where to maintain the Tax Identification Number (VAT / Tax ID) in SAP Sales Cloud Version 2?
entry.content:
Hello everyone,

We are implementing SAP Sales Cloud Version 2 for both corporate accounts and individual customers, and we cannot find any field to maintain the Tax Identification Number (Tax ID / VAT ID).

In previous SAP systems such as SAP CRM, SAP ECC, or SAP S/4HANA, the tax number is a mandatory and country-dependent field, including format validations, duplicate checks, and legal controls.

In Sales Cloud V2, we only find the section Identification Types under the Account entity, but this seems to be designed for external IDs and doesn’t provide:

  • Country-specific validation rules,

  • Duplicate management,

  • Search or match functionality,

  • Integration relevance for invoicing or fiscal documents.

This information is critical in any commercial scenario, as the Tax ID uniquely identifies the customer and is required for downstream processes in ERP billing and legal compliance.

My questions:

  1. Where should the Tax Identification Number be maintained in the standard Sales Cloud V2 data model?

  2. Is SAP planning to introduce a dedicated field or validation logic for this purpose?

  3. Are there any recommended best practices or workarounds (for example, using the Account Identification entity with a specific ID Type)?

Thanks in advance for your insights.

Best regards,
Jorge Ocampos
SAP CX Consultant

entry.title: Re: Data synchronize not happening in the EABLG and EABL...
entry.content:
• Was there any instance of an unwanted outage, technical issue in the time-window of those records on your SAP-system?
  • Were there any Dumps / UpdateErrors etc.?
  • Does your situation correspond to the behaviour mentioned in Notes such as 3349117 - EL37 leaves inconsistent meter reading documents (EABL without EABLG) - SAP for Me / 3349538 - Error prevention mechanism for inconsistent meter reading documents (EABL without EABLG) - SAP for Me / 1091077 - Enhanced error prev mech SAPSQL_ARRAY_INSERT_DUPREC w/ EABL - SAP for Me / 2145663 - Error prevention mechanism for inconsistent meter reading documents (EABL without EABLG) - SAP for Me / 2439650 - After change / reversal: EABL without EABLG - SAP for Me ...
  • And quite important : Are there any BAdIs / UExits or other forms of Custom coding involved that could possibly have side-effects or bugs?

If answers to (all of) the above is "NO", you should raise a SAP-Support Ticket ...
Inconsistencies shouldn't occur, and if they do, it should be traceable in "ST22" "SM21" "SM13" or other logs of some kind. Check for SAP-Notes to upgrade your system.

You should try to trace back to the steps where the specific EABL-EABLG records were created or changed, and try to match that to what logs provide as evidence ...

Hope this helps

Nic T.

entry.title: Materials Management
SAP Developer News October 30th, 2025
entry.content:
DESCRIPTION 

PODCAST: https://podcast.opensap.info/sap-developers/2025/10/30/sap-developer-news-october-30th-2025/ 

 

Devtoberfest Digest 

  • Devtoberfest Digest: https://url.sap/devtoberfest-digest 

 

Documentation collaboration and contributions 

  • Building Enterprise Grade CAP applications using BTP Developer's guide https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=tUKMUIL9C6k  
  • Get to know more about CAP’s documentation offering https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=gvjbxitDf18 
  • SAP BTP Developers Guide https://help.sap.com/docs/btp/btp-developers-guide/btp-developers-guide 
  • Open Documentation Initiative (podcast episode) https://podcast.opensap.info/open-source-way/2021/11/24/the-open-documentation-initiative-the-gold-standard-of-collaborative-documentation/  
  • Runtime Comparison Guide https://help.sap.com/docs/btp/comparison-btp-runtimes/runtime-comparison 

 

SAP TechEd 

  • Event Page: https://www.sap.com/events/teched.html 

 

SAP Community Voice 

  • October SAP Community Voice Post: https://community.sap.com/t5/what-s-new/sap-community-voice-get-ready-for-sap-teched-certifications-and-upcoming/ba-p/14255481 
  • Video Playlist: https://youtube.com/playlist?list=PLpQebylHrdh5ZmJeJXl_pC9n7LcsfFjrZ&si=gr0wPQhCkXiWHhLC 

 

CHAPTER TITLES  

0:00 Intro 

0:10 Devtoberfest Digest 

2:13 Documentation collaboration and contributions 

4:03 SAP TechEd  

4:36 SAP Community Voice 

 

TRANSCRIPTION

[Intro] This is the SAP Developer News for October 30th, 2025.

[Antonio & Javier] Hola, SAP Developers. We just wrapped up Devtoberfest last week, but I know that many of you are still trying to catch up with all the great content that's part of Devtoberfest. Well, my friend Javier here developed a very nice tool called Devtoberfest Digest that can help you with this. Javier, can you share with us a bit about what Devtoberfest Digest is and what was your motivation to develop it? Hello, this is Javier Martin from the BTP solution advisory team in Spain. And well, the Devtoberfest Digest is an AI-powered solution that kind of watches all the sessions that you deliver on the event and magically extracts the relevant information from the different videos so you can get the key points and relevant data for your interests. Perfect. And what was your motivation to develop it? Well, my motivation, yeah, let's say that I heard that there was some new MCP servers that was already released, like the CAP and the Fiori MCP servers, so I wanted to test them out. And, well, I was kind of struggling with time, right, to follow all the great sessions, so just the idea came really quickly. Fantastic. And what are some of the technologies that power Devtoberfest Digest? So for the backend, I use CAP, a cloud application programming model. There is Fiori as well for the frontend, HANA Cloud for persistence. And I'm also using the orchestration service from the generative failure hub for LLM access. Nice. And where is it that everyone can access this tool? Yeah, so the tool is already developed on the BTP. We already created a short URL for you guys to consume it and well, I hope you find it useful. I'm sure I will find it useful because there are many sessions that I still need to catch up. Definitely. So thank you very much for sharing this with the community and I hope you all enjoy it. Thank you. Ciao.

[DJ] Here is a shout out to all you lovely content collaborators. During Devtoberfest, we had a couple of great sessions on documentation and documentation contributions. René and Mahadi gave us a great overview of the CAP documentation and explained the different ways you can get involved by sharing feedback or contributing content. Gopal talked about enterprise-grade capabilities for CAP apps with information based upon the SAP BTP Developers Guide, which is also open for collaboration as well. Don't forget that the Open Documentation Initiative is still very much alive and well, with plenty of documentation sets. In fact, there's been a recent edition of the Runtime Comparison Guide, and there are also still contribution badges to be earned, as well as just cool points from having your GitHub avatar listed in the repo. Alternatively, you can also just leave a question or comment directly on the relevant page in the SAP Help Portal if you wish—the choice is yours. By the way, talking of the SAP BTP Developers Guide, this has had some updates and improvements recently. There's a new strengths and benefits section for all major runtimes, there's a new security guide with info for all the different relevant aspects or development phases of CAP development. And there's also a new section on developing software-as-a-service offerings, especially interesting, I suppose, for SAP partners and other software vendors. Anyway, have a look at the documentation and get involved.

[Tom] You might have noticed that the SAP Developer News was a little lighter this week. Well, that's probably because next week is SAP TechEd. And of course, who would have news about a new release or a new feature coming out just the week before TechEd? Of course, we're going to have tons of news from SAP TechEd virtual and Berlin and TechEd on tour. So be on the lookout for special episodes of the SAP Developer News next week, live from Berlin. We will bring you all the updates and announcements from the event. But speaking of SAP TechEd, we also have the Community Voice. And this is a new offering, kind of a monthly newsletter format to keep you abreast of all things that are going on in the SAP community. This month, they have a lot of information to help you get ready for TechEd and get the most out of it. They also have a wrap-up of Devtoberfest, information about new certifications, blog highlights, all kinds of good content. So be sure to check that out. Make a great thing to read as you're getting ready to travel to SAP TechEd or SAP TechEd on tour. And if you are going to be there in Berlin next week or Sydney or India later in the month, we look forward to seeing you there. So until then, have a great trip and a great TechEd.

entry.title: [Webinar] SAP Cloud ALM con Clean Core: Novedades y Funcionalidades Más Recientes

Únase a este webinar exclusivo para descubrir las últimas actualizaciones del SAP Cloud ALM con el enfoque de Clean Core. Conozca cómo las nuevas funcionalidades ayudan a mantener su entorno SAP limpio, estable y preparado para el futuro. Observe demostraciones en vivo, obtenga consejos prácticos y explore el roadmap de la solución.

Registre-se aquí

Temas principales

  • Qué es el concepto de Clean Core y cómo implementarlo con SAP Cloud ALM
  • Nuevas funcionalidades y mejoras más recientes
  • Demostraciones en vivo de monitoreo e implementación
  • Mejores prácticas para mantener un sistema limpio y sostenible
  • Roadmap: próximos pasos en SAP Cloud ALM

Requisitos previos

Antes de participar, se recomienda completar los siguientes pasos:

  • Active su tenant de SAP Cloud ALM (si aún no ha sido aprovisionado):
    👉Provisionamiento SAP Cloud ALM
  • Consulte el video tutorial: Cómo Solicitar SAP Cloud ALM en SAP for Me
  • Tenga a mano su ID de usuario y contraseña utilizados para el tenant de SAP Cloud ALM y el cockpit de BTP.
  • Acceda al cockpit de BTP: https://account.hana.ondemand.com/#/home/welcome
  • Revise el correo de notification@sap.com con el enlace de acceso y las siguientes instrucciones.
  • Consulte la guía de configuración: Configuración y Administración para SAP Cloud ALM

entry.title: What’s new with SAP Business AI, Joule, and Joule Agents in the SAP SuccessFactors 2H 2025 release
entry.content:
SAP SuccessFactors’ second half 2025 release represents a major leap forward for AI capabilities across our HCM solutions, beginning with the introduction of our first of many planned AI agents. These agents, led by SAP’s copilot, Joule, mark a pivotal shift in how HR leaders will use artificial intelligence to create more responsive, efficient, and human-centered workplaces. Let’s look at our new AI agent and some other key AI-related highlights in the 2H 2025 release.

Empowering Managers with the Performance and Goals Agent

The newly available Performance and Goals Agent helps managers lead more meaningful performance conversations. By automatically gathering relevant data, from goals and achievements to feedback, Joule delivers personalized discussion points and suggests follow-up actions like scheduling one-on-one meetings or updating goals. This elevates coaching from administrative to strategic, enabling truly continuous performance management. If you want to learn more about the AI agents for HCM announced recently at SAP Connect, please visit this page.

 Joule Integration with Microsoft 365 Copilot

Through its integration with Microsoft 365 Copilot, Joule now connects data and workflows from Teams, Outlook, OneDrive, and SharePoint directly within SAP SuccessFactors. This unified experience reduces the need to switch between systems, letting users complete tasks, retrieve insights, and make decisions directly in the flow of work.

Smarter Pay Transparency with Explain Pay

Employee Central Payroll users in Germany, Mexico, and Brazil can now access the Explain Pay feature in Joule. The capability provides natural-language explanations for pay-related questions, cutting resolution time by up to 50%. This delivers the transparency and trust employees increasingly expect while decreasing HR support load.

Expanding Generative AI Access and Joule Actions

SAP has expanded generative AI availability to private-sector customers in Saudi Arabia, offering AI-assisted writing and goal-setting across HR workflows. The update also broadens Joule Actions, allowing users to upload files, view employer information, access extended time-off data, and create half-day leave requests, all via conversational prompts.

Learn More

In short, the 2H 2025 release of SAP SuccessFactors strengthens the platform’s role as an intelligent, interconnected HR ecosystem that drives productivity, trust, and engagement, all powered by Joule and SAP Business AI. You can discover more 2H 2025 innovations across the suite by checking out the release highlights brochure, overview video featuring Bianka Woelke, and much more on the Product Release & Road Map Information page.

Together, these innovations demonstrate SAP’s vision for an HR future where AI doesn’t just support processes, it redefines them. By embedding agentic intelligence throughout SuccessFactors, SAP gives HR leaders the tools to transform data into action, decisions into impact, and every moment at work into a more connected, individualized experience.

entry.title: Issue in SAP BPA Standard Flow “Automatic Creation of Sales Order from Unstructured Data (5LT)”
entry.content:
Hello experts,

We are implementing the SAP Build Process Automation (BPA) standard content “Automatic Creation of Sales Order from Unstructured Data (5LT)” to automatically create sales orders in SAP from customer documents received via email.

However, we are facing an issue of email Signature Images Also Getting Posted in Sales Order Request

This leads to unnecessary attachments being processed and posted in SAP.

What we have checked so far

  • The incoming email to BPA includes one main PDF (order document) and multiple inline PNG files from the sender’s signature.

  • The BPA flow processes all attachments together without filtering based on file type or content.

Our questions

  1. Is there a standard way in this BPA flow to filter attachments so that only relevant documents (e.g., PDFs) are considered for processing?

  2. If not, what is the recommended approach or extension point to add such filtering logic?

Any pointers or configuration guidance would be appreciated.

Thanks & Regards
Aman Mittal

entry.title: Smart Table with annotation.xml
entry.content:
Hello,

I created a freestyle application configured with an OData V2 service. After generating the project, I added an annotations.xml file to define the columns for my entity type. Then, I added a SmartTable controller bound to my entity.

However, the columns are not being displayed in the SmartTable.
Could you please help me understand what might be missing or incorrectly configured?

Thank you.

Main.view.xml

<mvc:View
    controllerName="dummy3.controller.Main"
    xmlns:mvc="sap.ui.core.mvc"
    xmlns="sap.m"
    xmlns:smartTable="sap.ui.comp.smarttable"
>
    <Page
        id="page"
        title="{i18n>title}"
    >
        <smartTable:SmartTable
            id="idSalesOrderSmartTable"
            entitySet="ZC_SALESORDER_HEADER"
            header="Sales Order"
            enableAutoBinding="true"
        />
    </Page>
</mvc:View>

Main.controller.ts

import SmartTable from "sap/ui/comp/smarttable/SmartTable";
import Controller from "sap/ui/core/mvc/Controller";
import ODataModel from "sap/ui/model/odata/v2/ODataModel";

/**
 * @namespace dummy3.controller
 */
export default class Main extends Controller {

    /*eslint-disable @typescript-eslint/no-empty-function*/
    public onInit(): void {

        const serviceUri = this.getOwnerComponent()!.getManifestEntry("/sap.app/dataSources").mainService.uri;
        console.log("serviceUri: " + serviceUri);
        const model = new ODataModel(serviceUri);

        this.getView()!.setModel(model);
    }
}

annotation0.xml

<edmx:Edmx xmlns:edmx="http://docs.oasis-open.org/odata/ns/edmx" Version="4.0">
    <edmx:Reference Uri="/sap/opu/odata/IWFND/CATALOGSERVICE;v=2/Vocabularies(TechnicalName='%2FIWBEP%2FVOC_COMMON',Version='0001',SAP__Origin='LOCAL')/$value">
        <edmx:Include Namespace="com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1" Alias="Common"/>
    </edmx:Reference>
    <edmx:Reference Uri="/sap/opu/odata/IWFND/CATALOGSERVICE;v=2/Vocabularies(TechnicalName='%2FIWBEP%2FVOC_UI',Version='0001',SAP__Origin='LOCAL')/$value">
        <edmx:Include Namespace="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1" Alias="UI"/>
    </edmx:Reference>
    <edmx:Reference Uri="/sap/opu/odata/IWFND/CATALOGSERVICE;v=2/Vocabularies(TechnicalName='%2FIWBEP%2FVOC_COMMUNICATION',Version='0001',SAP__Origin='LOCAL')/$value">
        <edmx:Include Namespace="com.sap.vocabularies.Communication.v1" Alias="Communication"/>
    </edmx:Reference>
    <edmx:Reference Uri="/sap/opu/odata/sap/ZUI_CUSTOMERS_SRV_V2/$metadata">
        <edmx:Include Namespace="cds_zc_customers_srv" Alias="SAP"/>
    </edmx:Reference>
    <edmx:DataServices>
        <Schema xmlns="http://docs.oasis-open.org/odata/ns/edm" Namespace="local1">

            <Annotations Target="cds_zc_customers_srv.ZC_SALESORDER_HEADERType">
                <Annotation Term="UI.LineItem">
                    <Collection>
                        <Record Type="UI.DataField">
                            <PropertyValue Property="Value" Path="OrderNumber"  />
                        </Record>
                    </Collection>
                </Annotation>
                
            </Annotations>
        </Schema>
    </edmx:DataServices>
</edmx:Edmx>

manifest.json

{
    "_version": "1.76.0",
    "sap.app": {
        "id": "dummy3",
        "type": "application",

entry.title: Re: Walkthrough SAP Cloud ALM Process Authoring
entry.content:
Thanks, Mohamed, for the great blog.
I'm a bit unclear about how to version custom solution processes. Is there a standard approach to versioning?
Currently, I copy the original custom process, rename it as version 2, apply the necessary changes, include it in the scope, and remove the original. Then I manually reassign all the documents linked to the original process to the new one.
Is there a more efficient method for doing this?
Appreciate your guidance!

entry.title: Business Communication System
entry.content:
Hi Team,


How to create a Communication System for new subaccount?

 

 


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: Business Communication System
entry.content:
Dear Customer, 

 

To create a communication system perform the following steps:

  1. On the initial screen of the Communication Systems app, click New.
  2. In the New Communication System dialog define an ID and a name of the new system.
  3. Make the required settings under:

    • General Data
      Enter system ID and system name.
      Contact Information
      Enter name, email or phone number of a contact person.

    • Technical Data
      Host Name: Enter the host name of the remote system for outgoing API service calls. Please note that the usage of localhost is not allowed as host name.

      UI Host Name: Enter the host name of the remote system for UI-related integration options (This entry is optional. If nothing is defined here, the API host name is used.)

      Logical System: Here you can define an alternative ID for the logical system that is required for IDoc communication.

      Business System: Here you can define an alternative ID for the business system that identifies the communication system in your system landscape.

      Port: Enter the HTTP port. The default setting is 443.

      Cipher Suites: Here you can define a set of encryption mechanisms you want to use as a basis for your communication. You can choose between different versions of TLS (Transport Layer Security). A default value is defined by the system and you can change this if required.

      Is Hub System: Depending on the underlying communication scenario, you can trigger B2B messages from Output Management for Electronic Data Interchange (EDI).

      If you are using a central hub such as SAP Ariba to which all your B2B messages are sent, select the Is Hub System checkbox. Alternatively, assign the required business partner to the communication system. Please note that only business partners of the type Organization are supported.

      Inbound Only: If you want your communication system to be used for a communication arrangement based on a communication scenario that only contains inbound services, we recommend that you select the Inbound Only checkbox. If this checkbox is selected, the input fields that are only required for outbound communication disappear.

      Cloud Connector switch: Indicates that the Cloud Connector is used for communication with this system.

      SSC Location ID: Enter the Cloud Connector ID

      If your scenario is uses RFC modules, and the Cloud Connector is not activated, the system uses WebSocket RFC. Therefore the remote system needs to support WebSocket RFC and you need to specify the client in the RFC Settings section.

      RFC Settings: Define additional settings needed for RFC communication.

      OAuth 2.0 Settings: Define additional settings if oAuth 2.0 is used.

      Note: The propagation of technical users from the cloud application towards on-premise systems can be enabled in the Communication Systems app. To propagate the technical user, you have to select the Cloud Conn. Technical User Propagation checkbox in the OAuth 2.0 Settings area (the checkbox is only active if the Cloud Connector switch is on). This is similar to principal propagation, but in this case, a technical user is propagated instead of a business user. When creating inbound users for oAuth 2.0, you can select the Refresh Allowed checkbox and define a Refresh Token Expiry Time in days, months or years. The default setting is two days.

      Remote SQL Access switch: Define additional settings needed to access remote databases via SQL:

      Select the required Adapter Name. This specifies the corresponding HANA Smart Data Access adapter and the type of access method to be used by the SAP HANA database to access the data. Use the field input help for the list of adapter names you can specify.

      Enter the required Adapter Configuration. This specifies the connection parameters for a given adapter.

      OAuth 2.0 Identity Provider switch: Before you can authenticate and get an access token to access resources using an OAuth 2.0 client, you have to configure a trusted relationship to the required SAML Identity Provider (token issuer).

      Upload the signing certificate of the trusted provider and define the provider name.

      Define the User ID Mapping Mode if you don't use e-mail addresses, but either logon name or global user ID.

      The User ID Mapping Mode is required when the SAML Identity Provider is creating SAML assertions with the NameIdentifierFormat unspecified.

      This setting is ignored when then SAML assertion is using the NameIdentifierFormat eMailAddress.

      Please note that the required authorization for calling the service is granted to the business user and not to the technical user. When you set up a communication arrangement using oAuth, you can click OAuth 2.0 Details, select the scope and click Granted by Business Catalogs to find the necessary details. This way you can retrieve the business catalogs that are required for calling the service.

      SAML Bearer Assertion Provider switch: Before you can authenticate using SAML2 Bearer assertions transmitted via the authorization header, you have to configure a trusted relationship to the required SAML Identity Provider (token issuer).

      Upload the signing certificate of the trusted provider and define the provider name.

      Define the required User ID Mapping Mode if it is unspecified and you don't use e-mail addresses, but either logon name or user UUID.

      The User ID Mapping Mode is required when the SAML Identity Provider is creating SAML assertions with the NameIdentifierFormat unspecified .

      This setting is ignored when then SAML assertion is using the NameIdentifierFormat eMailAddress.

      OpenID Connect switch: Before you can authenticate using OpenID Connect, you have to configure a trusted OpenID Connect Provider.

      Define the required User ID Mapping Mode, the OIDC Token Issuer and Client ID. Click Import Metadata. This is necessary to ensure that the configuration is validated and complete.

      If the automatic configuration fails, you can configure the OpenID Connect settings manually. For more information, see Manual Configuration - OpenID Connect (OIDC) Provider in the Related Information section.

       
  4. Add technical users for inbound and/or outbound communication. You can either select a user from the list or create a new user. If you decide to create a new user for inbound communication, you can click New User and you will be redirected to the Maintain Communication Users app. For more information about authentication methods for outbound users, see the Related Information section.

    Inbound users are communication users provided by your system and are used by the communication system to call the inbound services. Outbound users are communication users provided by the external communication system to call the outbound services.

  5. Save your changes.

    You can now establish a communication arrangement with the created system. Use the Communication Arrangements app for this purpose.

 

If you have a specific scenario, please discuss with your SAP Representative. 

 

Kind regards,

SAP Support.
